name: Hotel Riu Caribe

reviews.title: Honest Review
reviews.text: My family of 6 (2 girls 13 and 15, in-laws 60's) stayed at this hotel Jan 13 to jan 20, we were greeted by a very friendly employee named Daniela. She took the time to explain every detail of the hotel,immediately making us feel welcome and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is my breakdown :
reviews.title: Felt right at home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - it is an older resort but very beautiful and functional, everything is at your fingertips and it has a traditional resort feel. Patrons were mainly British, Canadian and American, a real nice mix. Lobby is spectacular and has a main bar where most seemed to meet in the evening.
reviews.title: Great value - Great staff - We had a ton of fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - They are perfect, showers work well, beds are typical(little hard like almost any hotel in cancun) but I slept well. We were on the 6th floor with a perfect view. Experienced noise a couple times but then again I experience noise at hotels in Vegas at $500 per night.
reviews.title: Well, I said I just wanted to sit on the beach...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach - Excellent beach with some sea weed/grass, its more like grass on the surface of the water with some accumulating on the beach. The hotel rakes contantly but to be honest it didn't bother me at all, its a little grass for goodness sake. And by the way, I walked 4 or 5 k in both directions and this grass accumulates along the entire beach, some hotels keep it tidy and some don't.
reviews.title: RIU Caribe was fair to good
Friendly hotel, overall very good
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the RIU Caribe and in common with others reviewers I would say that it mostly lived up to expectations. We had a lovely room on the eighth floor over looking the pool/sea. Firstly good points.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 1. Lovely friendly staff, willing to help.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach
Not good!
reviews.text: 2. Excellent service both within the bars and restaurants, the best I have experienced on an all inclusive. Bar staff refill drinks without being asked!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 3. Lovely environment within the hotel, both relaxing if that is what one wished, or lively by the pool area. The beach side location is ideal.
reviews.title: Riu Caribe gives you less than you would expect from a 4 star hotel
Caribe is Fantastic!!
reviews.text: 4. No problems with maid service room cleaned to good standard every day. Minor problems with the air con and a slow draining sink in the bathroom attended to straight away.

reviews.title: Riu Caribe a great bargain
reviews.text: I sure don't know why there are complaints about this hotel. It offers great value for the money and, sure, there are a few areas that need improvement but overall it just doesn't get any better for the price. We read TripAdvisor faithfully before travelling and the one thing that stood out was that 'the beds are hard'. Well a quick trip to Walmart solved that little problem with the purchase of a $15.00 foamy. It did take a bit of space in our luggage but certainly didn't weight too much (and we left it there at the end of our vacation),

reviews.title: RIU was great....
reviews.text: The specialty restaurants are one of the areas in need of improvement but the general restaurant had so many choices that it became our restaurant of choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff (and I mean all staff) were superior in meeting the needs of their guests. From the initial check-in, to the entertainment, to housekeeping, to security, all performed well above expectations.
reviews.title: Relaxed at the RIU Caribe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Holidays are what you make of them. Thanks to the staff of the Riu Caribe, we had a great one!
reviews.title: Riu Caribe was wonderful!!!
Loved the Riu Caribe !
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here the weekend after Valentines Day, and even though the weather wasn't opportune, we still had a great time.

reviews.title: **5 star***
reviews.text: I would definatly recommend staying at the Riu Caribe to anyone. I have no idea who these people are complaining soo much. As soon as we arrived, there were bellboys taking care of our bags as we checked in, got a drink and was explained everything about the hotels amenities. This was quick, 10-15 mins. We got upgraded to the presidential suite, there is only two in the whole hotel and there is a pool on the balcony!! The room was soo big, although there was only two of us, it was still nice. I had e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival, and I had originally booked a junior suite (which by the way look very nice, some have a small living room and the others are on the sides of the hotel with huge balconys, definatly worth it and you are guaranteed a awsome view) but they gave us that room. Very nice! We left 1$ a day for the maid and 2$ on the last day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We only ate at Albertos and the buffet outside during the day just because the food was soo good there, no complaints, did not get sick at all, but breakfest was certainly the best of all, I was excited for it everyday! We did book the steak house a couple of times but always missed our reservation because we were so busy. I personally liked the self-serve ice cream..mmmm.. There is always food available 24 hours a day and there is a store in the hotel but I recommend going to the pharmacy right next door to the hotel (it is attached to the hotel but you just have to walk outside down the driveway 1 min.) and things are much cheaper there. The beach is soo nice! We went walking down the other hotels beaches one day and ours was by far the best. Very clean, no seaweed (if there is the staff cleans it every morning by 7 or 8) and big. The loungers are nice and comfortable and you can get one anytime during the day, only if you want specific ones I would recommend saving in the morning when you wake up, no need to get up extra early as long as it's before 10am. There is always staff cleaning everywhere, in the restaurants, bathrooms, lobby, outside etc. We did the bar crawl, Xel-ha and the jungle tour and I would recommend all 3. But there is always something going on at the hotel. There are shows every night at 9pm and the entertainment team goes to a diff. bar each night at 1030 with a bus that takes you there and you get in vip and vip seating. All in all I dont see what people can complain about?!? I would suggest when reading these reviews just to watch what people are actually complaining about becuase most of the time it is such small things I dont even see how it would ruin your trip. Relax, have fun! Oh we also went to the island right across from the hotel, so fun, beach there is soo nice! Its 15$ roundtrip on a ferry and you can walk there (you depart at captain hook). It was awsome becuase once you get into the middle of the ocean the water is soo blue, you have to see it with your own eyes.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

likes.liked: — All the organized activities and the staff
likes.disliked: — Repetitive food and annoying reservations for restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Initially, we had some complaints...the food at the buffet was very repetitive, it was difficult to make reservations at the restaurants, there was lots of noise in the hallways (lots of slamming doors especially in the morning), and the fees for using the internet were rediculous. However, after visiting several other hotels in the area, we realized how fabulous our stay at the RIU had been. Yes, the food was repetitive, but when we did manage to get a reservation at one of the other restaurants, they were great. Snacks and drinks were also available any time! The staff was quite friendly, and there were lots of organized activities every day. It was too bad that there was no nightclub on the premises, but a shuttle bus took interested folks to a club every night. The nightly shows at the hotel were also enjoyable. The beach was lovely and our room was nice as well, with a great view over the pool and ocean. If we travel back to the Cancun area, we would definitely consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, no worries

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Me, my girlfriend, and my two friends (20 year olds) stayed at the resort from February 10-17th, 2007 and had a great time in Cancun and the Riu Caribe.
reviews.title: Much fun at Riu Caribe!

likes.liked: — The feeling that you didn't even need to leave the hotel to have a great time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK IN: Greeted with a drink, front desk guy was friendly. We wanted two rooms beside each other so they said it would be a two hour wait. It was no big deal we just walked around a bit, found the pizza place to eat, and came back an hour later and our rooms were ready.
reviews.title: Beautiful Views from Corner Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wow...I'm not sure where some of these other guests stayed...but we thought the Riu Caribe was WONDERFUL. Clean, courtesy staff, fantastic food and did I mention clean! We were greeted immediately by our travel representative - who had everything ready for us - wristbands - towel keys - so we could eat and enjoy the pool or beach area while our rooms were being prepared. We thought the food selection was exceptional - if you love fresh fruit, salads, and some out of the ordinary foods - you will love it. Breakfast buffet was out of this world!!! We travelled with our teenage son and thought the activities pool and oceanside were GREAT. No spring break atmosphere as far as we're concerned. My husband is a non-drinker and he never felt exculded because of drinking activities. The entire staff was wonderful!. The activity directors - Michael, Cristian, Joseph and Amanda - made sure to make everyone feel welcome - a a special thanks to Michael for going out of his way to make my teenage son feel so welcome. If you are looking for a family fun vacation this is the place to be. Can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: our stay was wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: Thanks Riu Caribe for making our visit to Cancun MEMORABLE.
reviews.title: Needs updated rooms, menu
The obligatory 'had a great time' title
reviews.text: Our stay was from Jan 13-Jan17!

reviews.title: Riu Caribe
reviews.text: When we booked the hotel, we were told it was a 4 star. Not!

reviews.title: Fine, not outstanding
reviews.text: The lobby was nice and the pool area was outstanding. The food was not good at all. The breakfast was the best meal. The rooms were very outdated. The beds were like sleeping on a slab of concrete. Every piece of furniture in the hotel was scratched, chipped, or broken. If you find a really good deal, then this hotel may be worth it, but don't spend a lot of money here.

reviews.title: love that staff :)
reviews.text: oh my gosh! whats with these snooty complainers?! they MUST be high maitenice because everything was awesome! yeah ok, youll get tired of the same food for a week but theres a pizza bar and the mexican retaraunt was great (the burritas were sooo tasty) the staff was AWESOME (christian, miguel, aydee, carlos....oh the list goes on!!) they always had activities going on in the pool and the drinks were great (carribean sea with an xtra shot of rum on the side, hey youll get drunk quicker)

reviews.title: Enjoyed ourselves
reviews.text: youve always got your fridge stocked with beer and water and the maids are just so sweet, they clean eveything wonderfully, they even cleaned our beds off, organized the giant mess on the dresser and even put our toothbrushes in a little cup by the sink (by the way brush your teeth with bottled water, dont want to risk it ) every night at 900 theres a different show at the outside theatre, we heard they were all soooo awesome but we just went to the micheal jackson one which was sooo great!

reviews.title: Eww....1 to 2 star hotel due to staff
reviews.text: The staff ie; Christian and others, take groups out every night to a different club or bar and its just so much fun and they take such good care of you.........just think, if your rude to the staff and dont tip them, why would they want to treat you well? you respect them they respect you and that what we did and we just had the BEST time! remember...tip tip tip, they are happy with anything you tip them! we loved it and we'd definetly go back to the riu caribe again!!! except we had the worst time at the airport....BE CAREFUL they will find a way to cheat you outta some money.......

reviews.title: Great Time at Riu Caribe
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Caribe for 5 nights, recommended by friends, and really loved it. It was our first time in Cancun (boyfriend and I). The Riu Caribe is at the top of the 7-shaped island, which I hear means it has better water/waves.

reviews.title: Att: Beware Singles
reviews.text: Our room was very large and clean. Keep in mind that it's Mexico and the rooms are not really American-standard/style rooms. The furniture was kind of old and worn, and you do have to step on a big stool to get into the tub to shower, but that didn't bother us. Our bathroom was huge, it was more than enough space. Our maids kept it spotless, which must have been a challenge with the huge tile floor and all our sandy shoes-- we did leave a couple dollars tip every night, not sure if that made a difference. Always had enough towels/toilet paper, and the minibar was restocked every other day, although you could go and ask for more and get it. There was no room service, and you couldn't order movies in the room, which was disappointing because we both love those things.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one week. Very nice hotel. Not 5 Star but very nice. We had a Junior Suite right on the ocean with a terrace that can hold about 50 people. It was Great. The beds are FIRM. We liked them. They were not hard. The food was OK, not 5 star but a lot of choices and service that cannot be beat. The Staff was very helpful. The Entertainment Staff was GREAT. They seemed to work 24 hours a day. A lot of activities for young and old. Well worth the price. Cancun Airport was another story. When you arrive Do Not talk to anyone. Go directly outside to your Transportation. All the reps are outside. The people who come up to you offering to help are really trying to sell you something or get you to go to a Timeshare Presentation. When leaving allow yourself a lot of time. Make sure that you pack all your liquids in your checked luggage. They check your carry-on twice(when you go through security and before you get on the plane) The seem to take a lot of stuff from people. Would Come Back Again!
reviews.title: Very Nice
Excellent
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Caribe for our honeymoon and I must say as we had never travelled further than Europe this was an excellent change for us. The food was great, the pool was lovely and the beach was even better. The staff were very welcoming on our first few days, but after that they did not pay much attention to us in the dining room. We had to ask for water etc which was sligtly annoying. Also the variety of dishes in the main restaurant was not that good after the first week it all seemed to be the same. At least you can book to eat in the other restaurants, Mexican, Steak House and Asian, where the food was wonderful. The rooms were very roomy with ample space for everything and they were cleaned every day and stocked up with drinks in the fridge etc. The added bonus is the optics in the room which are also included in the price you pay, very handy if you want to have a drink at any time of the day and not have to go to the bar for service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: In all we throughly enjoyed our honeymoon there and it will be a holiday to remember.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel - great allround

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: got back from this fantastic hotel on tuesday and are very sad to be back. The hotel itself in comparison to the Riu Cancun is slightly dated. The food can become a little repatitive with lunchtimes having slightly reduced options. The entertainment team was great - working non stop - where did they get their energy from?
reviews.title: Incompetent Management and staff!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bar staff were absolutley great - expecially Juan and Jose and Rigo :) who plied us with great cocktails including superman, spiderman and some too rude to mention!!!!
reviews.title: Great Experience! Caribe Rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at many all inclusives and The Riu Is probally the worst one by far. The location is very far from downtown, The food was not edible, and It DID take a long time to get anything via the room.
reviews.title: Worst All Inclusive by far

likes.disliked: — The food, Staff, and Resort location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff wasnt that personable. Im sure others would disagree, but I have stayed at Couples resorts and the staff chat with you at the bar, while your walking around , etc. Not here.
reviews.title: Great Time!

likes.liked: — The hotel was clean, food was great and staff was outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also felt kind of out of place being an american.
reviews.title: Riu Caribe!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Heaven! Don't hesitate to book this hotel
reviews.text: The one good thing is the beach is private and blocked off.

reviews.title: Perfection with a capital 'P' (and i'm not just talking about the sexy reps!)
reviews.text: I would recommend The Riu to Anyone on a budget, Europeans, or young families. If you have been to Nicer AI, Like Sandals, or Couples, you will be very very dissappointed. GL!

description: Located in Cancun's resort area. 9-story building. On the beachfront. Complimentary sun loungers on the beach. 3 km. /1.9 miles from a shopping center. 4,5 km/2.5 miles from downtown Cancun. 21 km/13.1 miles to Cancun Int'l. Airport. Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa
